title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, there should be a dialog box providing a "Do you want to save your file", with options for Yes, No, and Cancel (which halts the shutdown).
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shutdown/reboot the computer.

Expected Results:
A warning or question message box should appear, giving users a chance to save their dirty model(s) before the computer is shut down/rebooted. Other Windows programs, such as Word and Outlook, provide this feature.
